sen.j: このため、治天の君→伝奏→武家執奏→室町幕府将軍の図式が崩壊してしまう。
sen.e: So, the system of relaying the message from Chiten no kimi to tenso-bukeshisso-shogun of Muromachi bakufu was collapsed.

sen.j: このため、永徳2年から遠くない時期に武家執奏はその役目を終えて実質上廃止となったと考えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that bukeshisso finished its purpose at the period not so far away from 1382 and was abolished.

sen.j: その後は治天の君に近侍する伝奏が直接自分達の上司でもある将軍・足利義満に伝達し、義満もしくは奉行などの幕府役人の意向も伝奏を経由して治天の君・天皇に取り次がれた。
sen.e: After that, tenso who served Chiten no kimi directly conveyed the messages to the shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA who was his superior, and the intention of Yoshimitsu or bakufu's officials including bugyo (magistrate) was vice versa relayed to Chiten no kimi or the Emperor through the tenso.

sen.j: そして、義満の朝廷政策に批判的であったとされる息子の足利義持もまた後小松上皇の院執事に就任している。
sen.e: And even Yoshimochi, who was Yoshimitsu's son and was allegedly critical about his father's policies against the Imperial Court also assumed the post of In no shitsushi of the retired Emperor Gokomatsu.

sen.j: そのため、伝奏が将軍に対して直接天皇・上皇の意向を伝達するのが慣例となった。
sen.e: Therefore, it became customary for tenso to directly relay the intention of the emperor or retired emperor.

sen.e: And later, the tenso who assumed the role to relay the intention came to be called 'buke tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government).'
